result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (6th) and Operating w/ PAC (6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Samuel A Smith was found guilty of OWI (6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consec to 11CF1371.  Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.  Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

superMiscConds.notes: $250 DNA surcharge + court costs remitted. $692  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.   Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervison or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.

May not reside anywhere there is alcohol on the premises. May not enter any establishment whose primary purpose is alcohol.  Defendant shall not use/possess drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Do not drive a motor vehicle without valid DL and written approval of agent & IID.
Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

supervisions.notes: IID restriction effective upon licensure for 36 mo

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Due to def's successful completion of the Earned Release Program on 3/25/16, court ordered DOC to effectuate the change from Confinement to Extended Supervision upon receipt of this Order.

Based on financial information provided to the Court by the defendant, the Court has found that the defendant's household income is no more than 150% of the federal nonfarm poverty guideline.
Therefore it is Ordered that an Ignition Interlock Device (IID) shall be installed and maintained for 50% of the normal costs.

Reporter:  digital recorder - 1:38
  Def waived reading of Information.  Def by Counsel enters a plea of NG.  Motions due w/i 20 days; bail continued.

Defendant in court with Attorney John D. Hyland.  Joshua M. Bowland appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing signed.
and Notice of DNA and Witness List (Plaintiff's)
Status conference on October 6, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.
- Defendant shall complete the booking/fingerprinting process prior to release.
  - Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle.
  - Defendant shall not consume alcohol.
  - The court orders a signature bond in the amount of $500.00 per case on the condition that the defendant reports to, and complies with, Dane County Bail Monitoring (DCBM).  The defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail.
  If defendant fails to comply with DCBM, cash bail is automatically set in the amount of $5000 (per case), as higher cash bail is necessary to assure appearance in court. BMP is removed as condition of bond.
  Defendant waived the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial judge -  Br 12

Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney  State Public Defender.  Adrienne E. Blais appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.  Status conference scheduled for October 6, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
